name: lsatssv
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0

stmt.origin: syl(w0, wss(c0, c1), wcel(c0, cfv(clss, c2)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wss(c0, c1))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(clss, c2)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cfv(clss, c2)), wss(c0, c1))
body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ⊆ c1)
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈(LSubSp ` c2))
⊣ (c0 ∈(LSubSp ` c2)→ c0 ⊆ c1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wss(c0, c1))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(clss, c2)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cfv(clss, c2)), wss(c0, c1))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ⊆ c1)
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈(LSubSp ` c2))
⊣ (c0 ∈(LSubSp ` c2)→ c0 ⊆ c1)

stmt.origin: lsatlssel(c0, cfv(clss, c2), c2, c3, w0)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(clss, c2)))
-| wceq(cfv(clss, c2), cfv(clss, c2))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(clsa, c2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c2, clmod))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c3))
body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈(LSubSp ` c2))
⊣ (LSubSp ` c2)=(LSubSp ` c2)
⊣ c3 =(LSAtoms ` c2)
⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c3)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wss(c0, c1))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cfv(clss, c2)), wss(c0, c1))
-| wceq(cfv(clss, c2), cfv(clss, c2))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(clsa, c2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c2, clmod))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c3))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ⊆ c1)
⊣ (c0 ∈(LSubSp ` c2)→ c0 ⊆ c1)
⊣ (LSubSp ` c2)=(LSubSp ` c2)
⊣ c3 =(LSAtoms ` c2)
⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c3)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(clss, c2)), wss(c0, c1))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c2))
-| wceq(cfv(clss, c2), cfv(clss, c2))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈(LSubSp ` c2)→ c0 ⊆ c1)
⊣ c1 =(Base ` c2)
⊣ (LSubSp ` c2)=(LSubSp ` c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wss(c0, c1))
-| wceq(cfv(clss, c2), cfv(clss, c2))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(clsa, c2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c2, clmod))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c3))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ⊆ c1)
⊣ (LSubSp ` c2)=(LSubSp ` c2)
⊣ c3 =(LSAtoms ` c2)
⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c3)
⊣ c1 =(Base ` c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wss(c0, c1))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(clsa, c2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c2, clmod))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c3))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ⊆ c1)
⊣ c3 =(LSAtoms ` c2)
⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c3)
⊣ c1 =(Base ` c2)

comment: An atom is a set of vectors. (Contributed by NM, 27-Feb-2015.)
